bestBHT.bht: Laborers in this story were hired at various hours, including the eleventh hour. However, this timing was uncommon, as it was only one hour before the end of the working day. The question raised was why these individuals had been idle for the entire day. Nevertheless, there was still room for them to be employed. This parable sheds light on the problem of unemployment and highlights the possibility of finding opportunities even in the final moments of the day.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: About the eleventh hour—but one hour before the close of the working day; a most unusual hour both for offering and engaging.
Why stand ye here all the day idle?—Of course they had not been there, or not been disposed to offer themselves at the proper time.
Albert Barnes: The eleventh hour - About five o’clock in the afternoon, or when there was but one working hour of the day left.
Archibald T. Robertson: All the day idle (ολην την ημεραν αργο). Extent of time (accusative) again. Αργο is α privative and εργον, work, no work. The problem of the unemployed.
John Gill: These different seasons of the husbandman's going out to hire laborers... may have regard either to the several periods of time, and ages of the world... or the various dispensations of the Gospel... or to the several stages of human life."
For the state and condition of God's elect, by nature, as it is the same with others, it is the same with them all."
Being about the eleventh hour, the day was far spent, it was almost gone, a small portion of it remained, but one hour.
John Wesley: About the eleventh hour — That is, very late; long after the rest were called.

bhtAttempts.bht: The parable in this verse tells the story of laborers being hired at different hours of the day, including an eleventh hour hiring. Commentators note that this is unusual, as it is one hour before the end of the working day. Those idle for the day were asked why they had not offered themselves earlier. However, despite the lateness, there was still room for them. This parable speaks to the problem of the unemployed and highlights the availability of opportunity even in the final moments of the day.

In this passage, laborers are hired at different hours of the day, even at the eleventh hour when there was only one working hour left. The parable emphasizes the unusualness of this timing and questions why they were idle for so long. Despite the lateness, there was still room for them to be hired. This parable reflects on the issue of unemployment and highlights the opportunity that can still arise even in the final moments of the day.

However, despite their lateness, there was still room for them to be included. This parable highlights the availability of opportunities, even in the final moments of the day.
